meanings.definition: To remove an item from a collection, typically a museum or library.
meanings.sent1: The museum deaccessions old artifacts to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent2: The librarian deaccessions books that are no longer needed.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator accidentally deaccessions a priceless painting instead of a replica.
meanings.sent4: She carefully deaccessions memories of the past to make room for new experiences.
meanings.sent5: The teacher deaccessions outdated lesson plans to keep the class engaging.

meanings.definition: The act of selling or disposing of assets, especially in a systematic way.
meanings.sent1: The deaccessions of company stocks led to a financial boost.
meanings.sent2: The deaccessions of old furniture helped declutter the office.
meanings.sent3: The deaccessions of unwanted items turned into a successful garage sale.
meanings.sent4: His deaccessions of unnecessary belongings symbolized a fresh start.
meanings.sent5: The deaccessions of excess inventory saved warehouse space.
